1. WASH Programs - Many organizations are implementing WASH (water, sanitation, and hygiene) programs to provide clean water and sanitation facilities to disadvantaged communities. These programs include building wells, providing water filtration systems, constructing latrines, and promoting good hygiene practices.

2. Community-Led Sanitation - Many organizations are also implementing community-led sanitation initiatives that involve working with local communities to identify and address their specific sanitation needs. This approach empowers the community to take ownership of their sanitation facilities and ensures that the facilities are designed and implemented to meet their specific needs.

3. Education Programs - Leading organizations are also providing education programs that teach community members about the importance of clean water and sanitation. These programs emphasize good hygiene practices, including handwashing and proper waste disposal, which can help prevent the spread of waterborne diseases and improve overall health outcomes.

4. Public-Private Partnerships - Many organizations are partnering with governments, private companies, and other stakeholders to develop sustainable solutions for providing clean water and sanitation facilities to disadvantaged communities. These partnerships leverage the strengths of each partner to achieve greater impact and ensure the long-term sustainability of these initiatives.

5. Technology and Innovation - There are also innovative solutions being developed by organizations, including water purification technologies, cheap and affordable sanitation solutions, and mobile-based monitoring systems. These technologies enable organizations to provide cost-effective and scalable solutions, reaching more people in need of clean water and sanitation.
